subject: Re: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
msgSnippet: Anyone knows how to use Junit testing in JbBuilder on NT box.I am doing all development work in JBuilder. I am doing testing on Unix box. I map Unix files in
messageBody:
Anyone knows how to use Junit testing in JbBuilder on NT box.I am doing all development work in JBuilder. I am doing testing on Unix box. I map  Unix files in Jbuilder by using WINCVS.

What  are the steps I have to follow to do Junit test on NT box using Jbuilder  assume that I have Junit testcase for NT box..

Alagu

Sarah Wustner wrote:

My group ran into something similar recently -- some people had built their code with JBuilder, and others had built with ant and the standard JDK.  We got odd errors when we tried to run code together that had been compiled differently.  Apparently, JBuilder uses its own internal JDK which is not 100% the same as the standard.  It would not surprise me if VisualCafe did something similar.Your best bet is probably to standardize on one or the other - either compile and run everything from inside of Visual Cafe, or use it only as your editor and instead use ant (or make, or whatever) to build and run. 
-----Original Message-----
From: David Roussel [mailto:dir@bjss.co.uk]
Sent: Wednesday, September 05, 2001 6:28 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
 
Sorry Pank I don't know the solution to you problem.  However I used to use VisualCafe 4 and now I have moved to Ant, Jikes and a text editor I suffer less stress.
-----Original Message-----
From: Pankaj Solanki [mailto:psolanki@ptc.com]
Sent: 05 September 2001 14:18
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit3.7 Error message
 
Hi all, Will any of you plz assess, why my SimpleTest.java file is failing : The problem I am facing is: When I compile a junit test file thru' VisualCafe4.0, it gets compiled without any error.Later while invoking the TestRunner utility from console (any approach - textui, awtui or swingui),I am getting following error message: java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: junit.framework.Assert: method assert(Ljava/lang/String;Z)V did not used to be static  at junit.samples.SimpleTest.testAdd(SimpleTest.java:32)But surprisingly if I compile the same file from console and run the TestRunner utility then test passes without any error and it show a green bar. Perfect run. My VisualCafe4.0 setting is fine (junit.jar and the directory which contain this jar file is included in the classpath of sc.ini file). Thanks, Pankaj
